meanings.sent1: The dastards in the story stole from the poor villagers.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the biggest dastard in town for his cruel actions.
meanings.sent3: The dastards tried to cheat their way out of paying for their meal.
meanings.sent4: The politician was called a dastard for his dishonesty.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was a true dastard, always causing trouble.

meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or treacherous manner.
meanings.sent1: She dastards when faced with difficult decisions, always avoiding responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were criticized for dastarding during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat dastards when it sees a cucumber behind it, jumping in surprise.
meanings.sent4: He dastards his way through life, never standing up for what is right.
meanings.sent5: The spy dastards around the corner, trying to gather information unnoticed.
